abstract: Chanel transformed the Grand Palais into an all-white seafloor, with pebbles, giant stingrays, coral reefs and the singer Florence Welch emerging from a clamshell to sing us a song.
snippet: Chanel transformed the Grand Palais into an all-white seafloor, with pebbles, giant stingrays, coral reefs and the singer Florence Welch emerging from a clamshell to sing us a song.
lead_paragraph: Chanel transformed the Grand Palais on Tuesday into an all-white seafloor, with pebbles, giant stingrays, coral reefs and the singer Florence Welch emerging from a clamshell to sing us a song. But, as Karl Lagerfeld said, volubly pleased with himself, "no mermaids."

headline.main: At Chanel, Everything but a Mermaid
